Label: coordinate system
Definition: Set of axes that spans a given coordinate space and of mathematical rules for specifying how coordinates are to be assigned to points. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 9.2, table 17 and annex B.2.
Definition 1 IGN: Set of axes that spans a given coordinate space and of mathematical rules for specifying how coordinates are to be assigned to points. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 9.2, table 17 and annex B.2.
Definition 2 ISO: set of mathematical rules for specifying how coordinates are to be assigned to points
coordinate system in Euclidean space with straight axes that are not necessarily mutually perpendicular

Label: cartesian coordinate system
Definition: Coordinate system which gives the position of points relative to n mutually perpendicular axes. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 18.
Definition 1 IGN: Coordinate system which gives the position of points relative to n mutually perpendicular axes. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 18.
Definition 2 ISO: coordinate system in Euclidean space which gives the position of points relative to n mutually perpendicular straight axes all having the same unit of measure
three-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space in which position is specified by two linear coordinates and one angular coordinate
coordinate system used by a DerivedProjected CRS
column12: one of an affine coordinate system
column16: a polar coordinate system or a spherical coordinate system

Label: ellipsoidal coordinate system
Definition: Coordinate system which gives the position is specified by geodetic latitude, geodetic longitude and (in the three-dimensional case) ellipsoidal height. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 20.
Definition 1 IGN: Coordinate system which gives the position is specified by geodetic latitude, geodetic longitude and (in the three-dimensional case) ellipsoidal height. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 20.

Definition 2 ISO: coordinate system used by an engineering coordinate reference system
column12: one of an affine coordinate system
column17: a polar coordinate system or a spherical coordinate system

Definition 2 ISO: coordinate system used by a Geodetic CRS
column12: one of a Cartesian coordinate system or a spherical coordinate system

Label: linear coordinate system
Definition 2 ISO: one-dimensional coordinate system in which a linear feature forms the axis

Label: ordinal coordinate system
Definition 2 ISO: n-dimensional coordinate system in which every axis uses integers. Note: The number of associations shall be equal the dimension of the coordinate system.

Label: parametric coordinate system
Definition 2 ISO: one-dimensional coordinate system where the axis units are parameter values which are not inherently spatial

Label: polar coordinate system
Definition 2 ISO: two-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space in which position is specified by the distance from the origin and the angle between the line from the origin to a point and a reference directionNote: A PolarCS shall have two axis associations.

Label: spherical coordinate system
Definition 2 ISO: three-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space in which position is specified by one distance coordinate and two angular coordinates
one-dimensional coordinate system used to record time as an integer countNote: A TemporalCountCS shall have one axis association.
one-dimensional coordinate system where the axis is time
one-dimensional coordinate system used to record a time as a real numberNote: A TemporalMeasureCS shall have one axis association.

Label: vertical coordinate system
Definition: One-dimensional coordinate system used for gravity related height or depth measurements. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 25.
Definition 1 IGN: One-dimensional coordinate system used for gravity related height or depth measurements. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 25.
Definition 2 ISO: one-dimensional coordinate system used for gravity-related height or depth measurements
two-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space in which position is specified by one distance coordinate and one angular coordinate

Label: coordinate system axis
Definition: Axis relative to which a coordinate of a point is specified in a coordinate system. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 9.3, table 27 and annex B.2.2.
Definition 1 IGN: Axis relative to which a coordinate of a point is specified in a coordinate system. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 9.3, table 27 and annex B.2.2.
